Reviews.Title: “Awful Service & not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: EMBJW
Reviews.Content: Tried to have Sunday lunch there...it was awful!! The girl trying to wait our table appeared as if she had not worked in the service industry ever before, she did admit after a series of errors and apologies that it was her 2nd week. She clearly had not been trained properly or was just not up to the job and should not have been allowed on the floor. Bad Management obviously. The Food was average and certainly not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “The best room ever!”
Reviews.Author: whiterabbit2
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend had the pleasure to stay there for the weekend. The best room we have ever stayed at. Lovely ambience, close to the city and what a great atmosphere in the main restaurant. Wow will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not really worth money we spent...”
Reviews.Author: ColchesterMummy
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in November 2011. I have booked the suite which I thought would be suitable for two adults and one child. When I called the hotel, nobody asked me for the age of the child - assuming that its a newborn! When we arrived it appeared that our suite is REALLY TINY! There was a double bed in the middle, and for my little one -they wanted to put a cot near our bed! When the receptionist saw our child, then immediately assured us that it will be sorted. It was, they put a tiny metal framed bed in our bed end. This tiny metal bed was incredibly uncomfy and noisy, so we ended up with the little one sleeping with us, not really something you dream about paying so much money for a 'luxury' hotel. Tiny bathroom, 'antique' smelly furniture, not something I would like to see and use in a 'boutique' hotel. I am not sure if the room has been cleaned before we arrived, I found old packet of cookies in the drawer of the bedside table. After we went out to town and we get back, cookies have been gone, so somebody definitely searched through the drawers, I had strange impression that our stuff habe been searched through too... No comments for that... The strangest thing was that when we got downstairs, the receptionist had completely NO IDEA where The Maze Grill is. We wanted her to call us a cab, but she had not a clue where this restaurant is located! Shame, Mr Ramsey should check maybe from time to time if his people do know who is he? That put us off, but after the night in the tiny bed, located just nearby the train passing by, we ate the worst breakfast ever downstairs. First of all, we have been ignored by all staff for first 30 minutes. I could not stand waiters and all the same people passing us by, not even asking what would we like to order. Shame, I had to go and ask the waiter to PLEASE finally bring us coffee and eggs benedict. Not really tasty, I think the worst I ever had. I was wondering if ham used to make this dish has been bought from the cheapest supermarket...No smell and plastic taste. Disguisting English muffin, not worth it! And then we had to pay for it, because BREAKFAST IS NOT INCLUDED when we paid £250 for the night. Ridiculous! Overall impression for the York and Albany downstairs restaurant - filthy, the curtains have never been washed. Definitely not worth the money wespend, please Mr Ramsay, pop in sometimes...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great food, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Katie24_12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary on a Saturday night. As soon as we arrived we were treated like royalty and the staff could not do enough to make our stay special. We had our room upgraded, which had a great view of Regents Park. The room was wonderfully decorated and felt very homely, with candles lit on our arrival. We had the best mojito ever in the bar, and then proceeded to have dinner in the restaurant. The food was fantastic, with every course as good as the next. We found it hard to choose what to eat as it all it sounded great! It was very reasonably priced for top class food. Overall the hotel, restaurant and bar were amazing and we would highly recommend it to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here. The staff are fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Elaine V
Reviews.Content: We booked in for our anniversary and were so well cared for. We had been upgraded to the suite on check in and things only got better from there. The staff couldnt do enough for us. The food was marvellous and the heated bathroom floor was good enough to sleep on. Well done Y&A - loved every second!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Week in London!!!”
Reviews.Author: Janet W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a 3 week holiday in Europe and for our first week, we stayed here at the York and Albany. One word - FANTASTIC!!!!!! - from the moment we checked in, which was very early in the morning after a long flight from Australia, till the day our week there ended.. We were lucky enough to get a room upgrade to the Fantastic Townhouse, which had a great bed to collapse into each night, very spacious, warm and comfortable suite with plenty of room and storage so you can "unpack" and actually feel like you live there for the week. Love the glass roof sections with opening windows (totally private) and the luxury of the heated slate tile bathroom floor. It would have been nice to have a jug/kettle to make your own tea/coffee, but it was easy to have tea/coffee sent to your room. It has its own little deck area with an ashtray! which was fantastic if you are a smoker like me, nice and easy to nip in and out for a quick ciggie in privacy and without upsetting anyone! Every single staff member went out of their way to make sure we had a great time, and were friendly, attentive, and were a pleasure to meet and talk to each day. The restaurant was great, we ate there for four out of the six nights we stayed and the salt and pepper squid was tasty, tender and the BEST I have ever had. We sat outfront of the serving area on the red lounge one night and it was great to watch the kitchen staff in full swing. Each meal they put up looked fantastic, and to watch the finishing touches and fussing that went into each plate, made you appreciate the meal even more. A big thanks has to go to James the chef for our wonderful "packed lunch" he made for us on the day we were leaving to catch the train over to Paris. I loved the tall backed chairs in the bar area which we sat at each morning and enjoyed the Full English Breakfast with juice and coffee,which kept you full till lunch time. The location is great, near the park and a stroll to the camden markets and underground train station. Overall, we could not fault the York and Albany, I highly recommend it as a Hotel and as a Restaurant, we will definitely stay here again. It really was a highlight of our holiday, and it was so nice to have staff that actually CARE if you were enjoying your stay and making sure you did!! 100% thumbs up!!! Janet Wood - Wollongong - NSW - Australia

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful night away”
Reviews.Author: LulieA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The York and Albany on Friday evening as a treat, a night away from redecorating our home and a long week of work. Arriving alone, I was greeted with a warm welcome and shown to our beautiful suite, Room 4. Separate from the main house, up a small flight of stairs to a roof deck and cute wooden door into the entrance porch. The suite itself was fabulously warm and the lighting created a perfect ambience. Having stayed before, it was great to see the little touches that have been added to the rooms; a lovely welcome note on the bed, a jogging map and the smell of jasmine candles really making you feel at home. The bathroom is stocked with White Company products, thick white towels and a huge shower. The Suite really has everything you need to ensconce yourself away for a night. However, rather than a cosy night in with room service we headed to the bar for dinner. I was escorted by reception to the bar and introduced to the bar manager. Once my husband arrived we were swiftly shown to a cosy table in a corner. Our dinner was fantastic and the staff very attentive, my mushroom and chestnut pasta was particularly delicious also the dessert of salt caramel divine. After an uninterrupted sleep in possibly the most comfortable bed ever we went for breakfast in the bar, its open from 7.00am. Greeted by the same staff as the night before, it was lovely to receive such a great welcome again. I would recommend The York and Albany to anyone looking for great service, a warm welcome and good food. We’ll be back and when the in-laws arrive in the summer we’ll be booking them in too!

Reviews.Title: “A Right Gordon Fest!!!”
Reviews.Author: Issy1150572
Reviews.Content: As the lucky recipient of some Gordon Ramsay vouchers for Christmas I went on to Gordon's website to book dinner at Restaurant Gordon Ramsay BUT to my sheer delight discovered that he has a townhouse in Regent's Park. No question what won! We checked in a bit too early but not an issue as we were given a table in the bar. The menu is so diverse and as we had a dinner reservation for the dining room and I wanted to save myself for the Rib-eye we happily shared a pizza at the same time enjoying a cheeky glass of Prosseco. After lunch the lady on reception checked us in and we were delighted with our room. I travel on international business so the room was perfect for us as it was a home away from home as opposed to a carbon copy of one modern room does all. I understand from Holly our receptionist that all the rooms are different which is very me. A beautiful Regency building and it honestly felt that we were just staying in a very rich friends townhouse! We went for a bracing walk in Regent's Park, laid on the bed watching afternoon TV and then back to the bar for cocktails. Dinner didn't disappoint and we had an amazing table on the rich red velvety banquette opposite the pass. Outstanding mussels would you believe cooked in Camden ale followed by the Rib-eye. I was in food heaven and full so I only had room left to share a super treacle tart with clotted cream. It was really nice actually because it was clearly Gordon's level of cooking BUT the service was really grounded and informal. Rolled on upstairs and slept very well; perhaps at the prospect of a full English breakfast with lashings of tea! To me this was the perfect gourmet experience and I just totally relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Ramsay all over - average and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Anuj D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our wedding night. My wife told them that when she booked. We weren't expecting anything, but something to mark that might have been nice, if only some congratulations or acknowledgement - nothing was said. £180 for the room, which was v standard and small. No breakfast. No prestige bath products. Sink in the room leaked. Boiling hot room. Someone started hoovering outside our room at 8.30am on a Sunday morning. The lift outside our room made this very loud and long repeating beep noise whenever it arrived - absolutely no idea why any lift would have such an irritating and intrusive sound, let alone one in a hotel! The bill was reduced to £150 but there wasn't much of an apology - I would definitely avoid this overpriced rubbish. I doubt Ramsay's organisation take the time to read these reviews (of which I note there are many) but his venues do not confer any exclusivity or high quality on your experience, yet still carry the price tag. Poor

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Content: we stayed on a thursday night. the meal was good, we only has pizza because we had been out for lunch. service was a little slow. the bed was the comfiest bed we had ever slept in. worst night sleep though, door beneath the room slamming closed every time someone went out continued til about 2am, staff putting out bottles, rubbish etc. also a hissing sound like a systern filling again til the early hours. such a shame lovely room, size , decor etc. breakfast was ok however not the best lincolnshire sausage! very draughty too, sat in the front windows looking across regents park, lovely location.

Reviews.Title: “not great”
Reviews.Author: 123ros186338
Reviews.Content: We only wanted teas a coffees on a quiet Thursday morning but it took ages to get served and the tea, particularly was weak and tasteless. Chilly table by a door which didn't close properly. Took ages to pay the bill afterwards. Stood at the bar and waved my purse around to attract attention - seems they'd lost the note of our drinks. And the ladies loo has the most impossible tap - could not work out how to get the water out!

Reviews.Title: “Refused to seat us when we had a booking”
Reviews.Author: TLBirch
Reviews.Content: My husband who is a long serving fire-fighter at one of London's busiest fire stations was recently awarded a Ramsay Voucher via his work. We had been very excited, yet undecided which restaurant to use the voucher at. We decided on York & Albany as a colleague of his had recommended it. My husband booked a table for us for 3pm Saturday 29 October 2011. We followed the directions provided on their website and allowed good time for delays and for the fact that I am heavily pregnant and can 'waddle a little slower' at the moment. We arrived at the restaurant a 3.06pm (6 minutes late). The bar staff directed us to the restaurant there were no staff to greet us immediately, however a well-mannered waitress passed us within a minute or so and asked if she could help. Whilst she was ticking us off the reservation list, what appeared to be a 'hostess' moved between us and the waitress, she ignored us and tutted, waggling her finger at the waitress saying "No. No. No!". We were puzzled how she could be so rude to her colleague when we realised she wasn’t criticising her colleague she was insulting us; ignoring us but instructing the waitress not to seat us as we were late. It was now only about 3.08pm. My husband asked what the problem may be and the 'hostess' curtly said without even making eye contact "What time did you book?". My husband confirmed 3pm. She then tutted again and said "3pm? Well you are late and the kitchen is now closed". I explained in a light hearted friendly manner that I am a little slower than usual walking as I am pregnant, and that we were only about 5 minutes late anyway; which is time that could have been swallowed up by us taking time looking at a menu anyway. There were several covers still left in the dining area who were still eating. My husband suggested if they could then contact one of their sister restaurants, who's kitchen was not closed, to see if they had availability and we would pop in a cab there. She completely ignored our request, and us, and reluctantly after speaking with her colleague said she would ask the chef if he would allow us to stay (??!) We both agreed that if the staff didn’t want to serve us and the chef closed the kitchen at 3pm (when our table had in fact been booked for) then we didn’t want to stay and feel uncomfortable and have half hearted input by the restaurant. We were very disappointed. We had so been looking forward to visit. Safe to say that we won’t be revisiting that restaurant. I very much doubt that my husband's work will be using Ramsay vouchers as rewards anymore and I have suggested that they not rush to the venue if any emergency calls are put in! Good customer services cost litte to provide if you have the right staff, nevertheless it can cost a lot if you have incompetent individuals who do not take pride in their work, or their colleagues or business’s reputation. Really disappointing and unfortunate manner from an amateurish hostess, which has sadly reflected on Gordon Ramsay.

Reviews.Title: “A pub with rooms”
Reviews.Author: tronson
Reviews.Content: Best way for me to describe this establishment, is a Gourmet Pub with accommodations. Part of the Gordon Ramsey stable of businesses, the property is located on the periphery of Regent's Park, and was to be our initial encounter with European Hotels - for the first two nights of our journey. Chosen by my wife for whom I don't hold a grudge against her, it was simply selected because of its close proximity to her office. Getting out of the cab, and maneuvering our luggage to Reception was the first hurdle to overcome - there is no driveway. One needs to alight at the kerb, and then schlepp one's bags down a cobble stoned passageway (not so easy with bag on wheels) - finally arriving at a large door made of glass and wood as one struggled to figure whether you had to pull or push to get through it. A simple sign on the door would have helped, but the only visible sign was the five-star AA (Automobile Association) accreditation badge on the wall behind the door - stating 'Restaurant with rooms'. I think the place needs a re-valuation... The Registration process was fairly straightforward, but one would not expect much else with just a handful of rooms to manage. Even so, I felt the lady on duty seemed somewhat stressed carrying out a pretty straightforward check-in. After getting our metal keys, we headed up to the 2nd floor, and thankfully, they had an elevator. The short distance seemed to take about two minutes to ascend but was a great relief, as I would have not wanted to carry the heavy luggage up, as could easily have been the case since there wasn't any staff to assist with that task. (My wife and I do not travel light, perhaps a mistake!) The room was quaint - although small - maybe 25sqm, but complete with facilities. One just had to take turns opening the wardrobe and wanting to get in or out of the bed. The same could be said for going in/out of the bathroom after needing to also place luggage in that part of the room. A faux fireplace pretty much covered up one wall, and the ledge above it was used to house two bottles of comp water and some glasses. Naturally, the desk was small, and could not be used at the same time as watching the TV. Air-conditioning was supposed to be provided by an in-room unit, but the outside air was definitely cooler, as experienced when we cracked open the windows. The problem with that practice was the fact that on a fairly regular basis, emergency vehicles whizzed by with sirens howling. This seemed to happen at all hours of day and night in London - and tranquility was something one could only dream of. The request for a second luggage rack was fulfilled by borrowing a chair from the hallway outside of the room, however, the luxury of in-room Tea/Coffee making service was not forthcoming. The shower as I regrettably discovered in a few establishments during our trip was built-in to the bath, but this one had the most bizarre curtain arrangement, and seemed whatever configuration you used for closing the curtains, the floor got soaked. Could this be the rationale for the oversupply of towels - to be used for mopping up water spillage? Our most unfortunate experience was that of pre-authorization on my wife's credit card. As you know most Hotels like to at least pre-authorize for the value of your room rate times the number of nights you are booked in - plus a reasonable buffer for incidentals. Well, she gave the card, and was told it was rejected. She gave another card and while this was being processed she strolled to the adjoining restaurant to take her breakfast. There minutes later and in front of the other dining guests, she was asked rather curtly to check her bank. It was surprising behavior as later we found out that the fault rested on their credit card processing system, and not her credit limit. Seems some people (in London) are a tad too hasty in jumping to conclusions, over matters that directly affect Guest Service (see 45 Park Lane Blog). On the day of departure - we had a leisurely morning, and decided to take our lunch in the Dining Room (really a converted Pub). While the food was good, and also the service, I cannot help but feel the food was not served in accordance to the menu description. For example, I ordered freshly grilled Sardines, and got a freshly grilled Sardine. To me - Sardines is plural, meaning more than one, and not one Sardine, which has been cut down the middle and served as two fillets. I did not point this out. On hindsight, maybe I should have. After checking out of the York and Albany (perhaps not a moment too soon for me), we headed over to the newly opened Dorchester sibling - 45 Park Lane, and a separate Blog (New kid on the block) detailed our less than perfect experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay - but seriously overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Suncreamgirl
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before, we travel a lot staying in lovely places around the world - most recently the beautiful Babington House in Somerset. I am not mega fussy but do like a nice hotel!! I felt compelled to pass on my thoughts of this 'hotel' as I normally have a good nose for finding a nice place to stay...and this one was a stinker! We booked for one night as meeting up for a birthday celebration in the restuarant. I thought it was a no brainer as have eaten in Gordon Ramseys other restaurants and stayed at Castell Monestero in Tuscany (which he is associated with and consults on the restaurant). We have always had a good experience and high standard of servce. We stayed in a deluxe room priced at £300 per night inc VAT and breakfast. Which is pricey but we enjoy staying in London a couple of times a year, previously spending the same amounts on rooms at Browns, Haymarket Hotel etc...and have always felt we have recieved excellent service and value for money. We arrived at about 4.30 on a Friday afternoon having luckily found a meter opposite to park on (which is free after 6.30 all weekend.) We struggled to find the entrance to the 'hotel' which is has no entrance signage and is tucked behind the pub. Its is also next to the stairs which lead to the noisey and smelly restaurant kitchen, with bins, old boxes and staff bikes in front of it - not very glam! Having found the entrance we then had to find a member of staff to check us in, after an awkward few minutes hanging around we went into the bar and a rather unfriendly woman said she would be with us shortly. We checked in and she seemed rather irrated that she had to show us to the room,she let us in and disappeared! The room was pleasant, a little shabby and unloved and very cramped. Everything looked like it could do with a paint or bit of polishing, but it was clean and as only staying one night it was fine. We had asked for a quiet room as knew the hotel was on a busy road, and the room was in a very quiet part of the building, but as the hotel backs onto the main line going into King Cross Station you still get the trains going passed - but the noise level was acceptable. The TV did not work and just said 'no satalite signal' we tried in vain to ring reception several times but got no answer it.....just rang and rang - so turn the TV off! The bathroom had under floor heating which was SO hot that you could not walk on it without shoes which was crazy, ended up putting towels over the floor to walk on. The products provided are supposed to be Miller Harris but the hotel had obviously ran out and had provided the little mini bottles you get from Boots of Tresemme and an odd make of Shower gel in bright yellow (not sure what is was) Although the floor was red hot the towel rail was cold and coming off the wall. You do not get any mini bar or tea making facility in the room, as no answer at reception for room service we went down to the pub for a coffee. We are not tight at all, and know London prices are high but do feel a litte uncomfortable paying £5.00 for 2 warm (not hot) coffees in tiny grubby cups which are just plonked in front of you from a very unfriendly waiter....charming! Anyway I think you probly get the idea....Could go on and on. This is not a 'hotel' by any stretch of the imagination it is a B&B above a pub/restaurant on a busy junction on the edge of Regents Park. Great if you want a room for the night but definately NOT worth £300 a night!!! When we checked out (by someone who didn't even know how to work the chip and pin machine!!) we feeling well and truely turned over having fallen for the glossy marketing and clever PR. The restaurant was nice and we had a loveley meal...wished we had just paid the £300 to get a cab home instead!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you are serious about steaks.”
Reviews.Author: chi_heng
Reviews.Content: it's our 2nd visit to this restaurant. our first visit in 2009 filled us with warm memory of good food and nice ambience, so we popped in for a 2nd visit when we dropped by camden town. Upon arrival we found the set menu for lunch has been scraped, and replaced with a new a la carte menu. i expected to be told what today's special was, but the friendly waitress made no mention at all when we placed our orders. strange, i thought. marinated olives and almond was nice, and salt and pepper squids was crispy and tasty. those were the only highlight of the entire meal. starter i had chicken liver and foie gras parfait, which tasted only of chicken liver and with a texture of melted ice-cream. scary stuff. when my sir-loin arrived i couldn't believe what i saw. it was charred and the meat was very dry and grainy. i tried half of it and both i and my wife thought it was overdone (i ordered medium). i made my comment to the waitress but she was adamant it was medium when it arrived at the table. the chef sent us a free dessert to compensate, which was ok, but the damage has been done. we paid a premium for this lunch, but the quality of the food was only on par with any gastro-pub. incidentally, the table next to us made comments to the waitress about their fish being overdone. i looked around and noticed the restaurant was less than half filled (it was 2pm when we arrived), so i don't think the kitchen was too busy at that time. my fond memory of this restaurant from our 2009 visit was tarnished during this 2nd visit, and i would definitely not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the most disappointing meal I've eaten in a long time”
Reviews.Author: JWPersonal
Reviews.Content: It started so well... Perfectly cooked tasty sardines with an olive tapenade and then went horribly downhill with the arrival of my steak. I love a steak and the lure of sirloin with truffle chips was too much to resist - I'm a medium rare type of guy so cooked but with a bloody middle. When it arrived medium well, I sent it back - a little surprised to have the maitre'd come to tell me that this is how they do medium rare here, perhaps he should try a medium rare steak at any other restaurant. 10 minutes later I received a rare steak that smelt on the turn (perhaps why it was overcooked the first time). For a rare piece of meat there wasn't a drop of blood and the smell was overpoweringly bad - if I were a professional chef, I'd be embarrassed to serve something quite obviously so wrong. with the exception of the maitre'd the serving staff were friendly and efficient. Unfortunately this is the second poor meal I've had in a row at the York and Albany and I won't be back - there are better places to spend your money in NW1

Reviews.Title: “On my list of places to return to”
Reviews.Author: Yblodyntatws
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. I was warmly greeted on arrival by the receptionist and I would note that all the staff I encountered over the two days were friendly and helpful. Room was smaller than I had anticipated - with nowhere sensible to do any work (as desk was a bit rickety) - but was nicely furnished, clean, had a comfortable bed and had a nice view over a neighbour's flower garden (so was generally quiet). Bathroom could do with some attention - blown bulbs in mirror and above bath, and paint peeling above shower head. However, I liked the option of the fixed shower head or hand-held. I ate with my son in the bar one night and we had good quality food. We also enjoyed one or two cocktails and it was nice to be in a "pub" which had a good atmosphere. Breakfast was OK - but my Eggs Benedict had been left standing under a lamp I think - so the poached eggs were a bit rubbery. Please note that the entrance to the hotel part is round to the right hand side of the building!

Reviews.Title: “We had a really good experience!”
Reviews.Author: Portugal611
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night at the Y & A and had a great time. The room was lovely, clean and really comfortable. The staff were really helpful and let us check in a few hours early because we had a wedding to get to. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Muchkin seating and catapillars”
Reviews.Author: LAUAR
Reviews.Content: On our first visit to the York and Albany we had sunday lunch and our daughter was served a cooked caterpillar on her pizza, disguised by the rocket. They apologised but added it to the bill anyway. Yes, i know, we shouldn't have gone back but we did... Today we walked out - furious. We had booked a table for breakfast but when we were shown to the table it was so low that we couldn't physically get our legs under it. Amazing for such a high grade restaurant. The waitress said there were no other tables - although one had a reserved sign on it. When we asked to sit there she said oh no, the people had reserved that particular table. We could see why no one would book the table for munchkins! She said we could sit at the bar on high stools - surprisingly we didn't want to eat the £25/head breakfast on a high stool. The waitress then left us and started serving people while we stood there. It became evident that they weren't interested so we just walked out in disgust. Although we love good food and nice surroundings while eating it there is nothing we hold more highly than good and warm service - if you want this don't go to the York and Albany. They haven't got a clue.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing & charming”
Reviews.Author: MrsMCR
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel as a surprise for my husbands 30th along with dinner at Maze Grill. We were welcomed on arrival by friendly and professional staff and informed we had been upgraded to a luxury room. The room was lovely, comfortable and well styled with a four poster bed and quirky bathroom. We found the service to be excellent and although there was a mistake on our bill it was quickly rectified with no fuss. My only regret is not having the time to try the picnics or spend more time in the bar sipping cocktails - definitely plan a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly couldnt fault it”
Reviews.Author: robinthered
Reviews.Content: We held our wedding ceremony and reception at the York and Albany and can honestly say it was as near to perfect as it could have possibly been. It is probably also useful to preface this review by saying that although it was our wedding, we had deliberately chosen this venue because we wanted a small and informal wedding day but with a good splash of luxury. We stayed in the hotel the night before and enjoyed some food and drink at the bar. Food was very good, we ordered pizza which is prepared at the deli next door. Very fresh tasting and clearly all hand made. One of the best pizza's I've had recently. We have eaten in the restaurant here before and had a very good experience. I didnt care much for the olives at the bar but thats not the end of the world. We are cocktail 'enthusiasts' and have drunk in most of the best cocktail bars in the capital. The cocktails here are not the best out there but still very good. All our guests who attended the next day were really raving about them, it is probably only our extensive experience of the best there is that stops me doing the same. I think the prices are quite reasonable as well, a couple of quid more than the average cocktail bar but again certainly less than most hotels. Room was great. Traditional but with a great bathroom and those modern touches that make all the difference eg under floor heating, a decent shower and lights in the wardrobe. Personally I thought it was decent value considering the quality of the hotel and its location but value is very individual. Our wedding day simply could not have gone any better. Prior to the wedding we had a wedding coordinator work with us who was really very good. We were very undemanding and probably made her job pretty easy. For instance we only purchased flowers on the wedding day itself, travelling into London to a florist we had seen and looked decent! One stand out thing was the quality of service. Everyone was not only extremely friendly but also very helpful, identifying minor issues and sorting them before we even noticed. Little things like noticing the sun was shining into some guests eyes through the window and asking if they could close the curtains a little. Both the wedding ceremony and the dinner were held in the regency room which is absolutely beautiful. It was so much better than a registry ofkfice and for the small amount extra you pay for the registrar it is completely worth it. There is no room hire charge and we had the room for the entire day subject only to a minimum spend of £2400 which was easily covered by a guest list of 24. Canapes and drinks in the reception were delicious, as was the food served during dinner. Guests were able to have a choice on the night and food was served at perfect intervals, hot, beautifully presented and by very attentive waiters. At one point the air con got a little cold and as soon as the waiter noticed a couple of guests put their jacket on he immediately adjusted back to a better temperature without so much as having to be asked. Honestly the service was some of the best I have ever experienced, including several very impressive hotels and restaurants. The difference here seemed to be the staff were actually enjoying their job, perhaps they just like weddings. Overall I simply cannot fault this place. Previous reviews talk of dodgy service but I have visited several times now and have never had a bad experience. If you are looking for a hotel that not only has great rooms but also great food and drinks then this is definately the place.

Reviews.Title: “'Underwhelmed, nice rooms but too expensive'”
Reviews.Author: travelclicktv
Reviews.Content: As it is part of the Gordon Ramsay group we were expecting great things, but were disapppointed especially with the ad hoc service. The rooms are beautifully furnished and we could not fault those but the staff did not seem to know what they were doing. Working out at nearly £300 for the room, breakfast and nibbles, we felt that we had paid way over the odds for a trendy gastropub with rooms. We ordered room service in the evening and after many phone calls, it finally arrived an hour later. The hotel offered us champagne as compensation but as we don't drink this was a futile offer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice food, disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: QuincasBorba
Reviews.Content: Tennis and fine food are two of our passions, so we planned our trip to London long time in advance in order to attend the ATP Tennis finals (Barclay Cup) at the O2 arena and dine at Jamie Oliver and Gordon Ramsay`s restaurants. For that purpose we booked at two different hotels. The first week in London we stayed in the area of CanaryWharf (close to the O2) and then we moved to the York & Albany in Camden Town. Since we had read some very good reviews of the Y&A and we just had a good experience at the Marriott the days before, we were a little bit disappointed. The first impression: The Y&A entrance is located besides the trash containers of the restaurant. That would not be too much of a problem, except for the fact that the containers are continuously in use. This creates a lot of noise because some bedrooms are precisely few meters away from them. Therefore, very late at night and very early in the morning, you can hear people disposing or retrieving trash. Also, the side street of the hotel has a lot of traffic and every time a heavy truck passed by, our room vibrated. It was quite difficult to sleep and we were tired most of the time. On the positive side the room service was reasonably good and the wireless internet connection was excellent. Rooms are clean (although old fashioned), but not very spacious. People at the reception were friendly. Service at the bar and at the restaurant was frankly disappointing. We noticed that there were too many waiters, but they spent most of their time chatting and away of sight, when their supervisor was not there. We confirmed this impression after we had lunch at other restaurant listed on Ramsay`s website: Maze, which was precisely the opposite. Service at Maze and its food were excellent. (Could it be because Ramsay supervises Maze more closely?) As for the food at Y&A, we were not particularly impressed. Maze was clearly a better choice. We must add though that the Deli at Y&A (Nona) offers a very good selection of traditional pizzas baked in the oven. The experience as a whole was very interesting though. Somehow we understood the point that some critics make. Namely, that once a celebrity chef decides to create an empire and allows his name to be associated to other projects and other chefs, high quality might be put at risk. For our next trip to London we will look for other options.

Reviews.Title: “Great Gordon Ramsay restaurant”
Reviews.Author: LAtraveler09
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at Gordon's Regent's Park adjacent restaurant. Although fairly empty at 7:30 mid-week, it filled up very quickly. The menu is small but we found the best option in the cote de boeuf for 2 which was amazing. It is served beautifully, on a large wooden board, beef perfectly cooked and cut with the side dishes also placed on the board. Wine list was good and our waitress was knowledgeable enough to help us choose. We were underwhelmed by the dessert options but were too full anyhow. On our way out, we glanced over at the gorgeous bar area and were then drawn to it for another drink. The bartender was so great and really into his job so he expertly made me a cocktail off the menu and made the most precise 'old fashioned' for my hubby. It was a perfect post-dinner experience. Can't wait to go back next time we are in London.

Reviews.Title: “Could Improve On Service”
Reviews.Author: Nunney
Reviews.Content: We had booked Sunday lunch for ourselves and two friends we were meeting in London. The greeting service was mediocre, we waiting a long time to be seated (we had booked about three weeks before). The food was excellent, we all had three courses, the only thing I could fault was the plate of cheese and biscuits, very meagre portion, and nothing about it looked attractive. The main problem was with our server, she was miserable, slow, and didn't seem to have a clue about taking food orders. We were not checked on any of our courses, and although the food was really good, the service definitely let the restaurant down. Not sure if I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service!”
Reviews.Author: lorrmac44
Reviews.Content: We had lunch here on Sunday 19th April and were greeted by a very forgetfull and arrogant bar staff, he askes our name 4 times! We had to place our drinks order twice because the waiter(s) was fooling around and cleaning the menu's..? (surely this should be done outside opening hours) also there was an array of dirty glasses on the bar in front of us or the whole time we sat there (30 mins.) even though two bar staff looked and them and looked away constantly! It was not busy at this point so no excuse. We eventually went looking for our table ourselves after having asked twice if it was ready and other guests were being seated, our waiter really is totally incompetent to work there. Out table turned out to be in the darkest far away spot you could imagine and we were told that no other alternative was available and that we should have requested a table upstairs. Having never been there before how were we to know this? After some persuasion and 3 members of staff later we finally were given another table and the Maitre'd gave us some complimentary drinks, she was very nice in explaining the situation however it still spoilt the mood of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely atmosphere, very very varied service - not sure if worth the ££££”
Reviews.Author: DerwenFawr
Reviews.Content: York and Albany promises quality, atmosphere and of course, fantastic food......being under the wing of Angela Hartnett in the Ramsay collection. Well......When you arrive at York and Albany, don't be disappointed, it's not a 'pretty' setting, particularly next to the tyre shop! It's also appallingly signed, particularly for hotel guests, you really have to take a guess at how to get in.........However, when you pass through the door, class and elegance hit you in the face, the decor is beautiful, stunning victorian refurbishment, mixed with ultra modern fittings. When you find the hotel check in desk, it is intimate and the staff particularly attentive - I was very impressed. The room....I booked the four poster deluxe double that is featured in the images on the website....it is stunning - beautiful antique furniture, stunning high ceilings, what's missing is the fire to give it the cosy finish and to be honest, the settee is a little 'shoved' in at the end of the bed. The bathroom is a little clinical, but is full of quirky features, but with the original windows is particularly draughty!! A lovely glass of champers on arrival was particularly welcome as I settled in, but alas, to no avail, whatever myself and the 'concierge' tried, we couldn't get our satellite TV to work - when we had booked the York and Albany 6 months before for a romantic laze away weekend, this was of particularly annoyance as we wanted to laze in bed and chill, read and watch TV, not go out and sightsee. Luckily there was another room available in the same category and after a quick look, we arranged to move. This one was much less traditional, but still as luxurious and had a bigger bed.........Lovely!! The Restaurant on valentines evening, was of course busy. The service though - BEWARE, is appalling. We were seated at 20:30 in time, but were not given a menu, or asked if we would like a drink for around 20 minutes. NOT what you expect from the reputation of Angela Hartnett and Ramsays. The food, was particularly good, the wine choice was also really satisfactory. Again though - despite liking the length of time to sit and eat for a valentines dinner (we ended up leaving at around 2330 - 3 hours later!), it was the attention to detail and the atmosphere that lacked from our less than interested waiter. Luckily for us, the company was great and we weren't in a hurry, but it wasn't necessarily that, it was the lack of interest as I say. Hence when checking out we refused to pay the 12.5% service - £25 quid in all for lacklustre service is just not on. The building inside is beautiful, the bar area surprisingly relaxed and not full of pretence. The food seriously good, and the deli offers lots of options adjacent! All in all a lovely, romantic weekend, but not quite up to the price tag is our verdict! Angela still has a lot to overlook if it's going to stay as busy as it currently is in its' early days........

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Boutique Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: SandALondon
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the hotel are gorgeous--traditional decor with modern touches. The bed is huge and we loved the wetroom in the bathroom. The hotel is attached to a great bar with amazing cocktails and a Gordon Ramsey resto. They offered us a table when we checked in which is impossible to get at the last minute on a Friday night. The location is excellent as well--just a two minute walk to Regents Park, Camden and Primrose Hill. A brief walk through Regents Park takes you into the city centre. My only complaint was that the bathroom didn't have a bathtub (room 8).
